![Chuncheon Myeongdong Street (ì¶˜ì²œ ëª…ë™ê±°ë¦¬)](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030528_image2_1.webp) ## Overview > The street was named after Seoulâ€™s Myeong-dong street as it became the main street of Chuncheon. Government offices, such as Gangwon-do Provincial Office and Chuncheon City Hall, and major banks are located nearby the street, and various shops specialized in clothes, cosmetics, and shoes, as well as cafes and restaurants are located in the street. The sculpture built to remember the street as the filming location for the Korean TV drama Winter Sonata is located in the middle of Myeongdong Street. In addition, the street has large shopping malls, such as M Department Store and Brown 5th Avenue, cinema, and other attractions. The large-scale underground shopping center established based on the Jungang Rotary, houses some 350 stores where customers can enjoy shopping and relaxation in any weather. The Myeongdong Street connects to other Chuncheonâ€™s tourist destinations, including Myeongdong Dakgalbi Alley of Chuncheon, Yungnim Pass, and Chuncheon Jungang Market. ## Intro | | | | - | - | |infocenter:|â€¢ 1330 Travel Hotline: +82-2-1330
(English, Korean, Japanese, Chinese)
â€¢ For more info: +82-33-250-3089| ## Detail Image ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030526_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030526_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030527_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030527_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030529_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030529_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030530_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030530_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030532_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030532_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030533_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030533_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2495147_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2495147_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2495151_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2495151_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/619243_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/619243_image2_1.webp) ## Contact - [â˜ï¸+82-33-250-3089](tel:+82332503089) - [ğŸ tour.chuncheon.go.kr](http://tour.chuncheon.go.kr/) ```googleMap latitude: 37.8800481627 longitude: 127.7275492614 title: 55, Jungang-ro, Chuncheon-si, Gangwon-do ``` ## Directions [Bus]
Take bus 7, 9, 64, or 64-2 across from Chuncheon Intercity Bus Terminal.
Get off at Myeong-dong Bus Stop. (10 min ride)

[Subway]
Chuncheon Station (Gyeongchun Line)
Take bus 63 and get off at Myeong-dong Bus Stop. (10 min ride)

data.title: Chuncheon Myeongdong Street (ì¶˜ì²œ ëª…ë™ê±°ë¦¬)
data.description: The street was named after Seoulâ€™s Myeong-dong street as it became the main street of Chuncheon. Government offices, such as Gangwon-do Provincial Office and Chuncheon City Hall, and major banks are located nearby the street, and various shops specialized in clothes, cosmetics, and shoes, as well as cafes and restaurants are located in the street. The sculpture built to remember the street as the filming location for the Korean TV drama Winter Sonata is located in the middle of Myeongdong Street. In addition, the street has large shopping malls, such as M Department Store and Brown 5th Avenue, cinema, and other attractions. The large-scale underground shopping center established based on the Jungang Rotary, houses some 350 stores where customers can enjoy shopping and relaxation in any weather. The Myeongdong Street connects to other Chuncheonâ€™s tourist destinations, including Myeongdong Dakgalbi Alley of Chuncheon, Yungnim Pass, and Chuncheon Jungang Market.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Eulji Observatory (ì„ì§€ì „ë§ëŒ€)
dataList.description: Eulji Observatory, located near the Military Demarcation Line along the ridge of Gachilbong Peak, is now one of the most informative sites dating back to the Korean War. From Eulji Observatory, visitors can see North Korean land from afar as well as Birobong Peak of Geumgangsan Mountain. It is the northernmost DMZ attraction and over 100,000 people visit this observation platform every year.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Eorayeon Valley -Gangwon Paleozoic Geopark (ì–´ë¼ì—°-ê°•ì›ê³ ìƒëŒ€ êµ­ê°€ì§€ì§ˆê³µì›)
dataList.description: A beautiful and mysterious valley located 12 km up the Donggang River, Eorayeon Valley is renowned for its clean waters and for the many fish that inhabit it.The valley has beautiful rock formations and a dense pine forest that were designated as the No.14 National Scenic Spot in December 2004. It is one of Koreas most popular sites for rafting, followed by Naerincheon Creek and Cheorwons Hantangang River. The trail to Eorayeon through Jatbong Peak is also quite popular (approx. 3 hours).
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Dutayeon Valley [National Geopark] (ë‘íƒ€ì—° (ê°•ì›í‰í™”ì§€ì—­ êµ­ê°€ì§€ì§ˆê³µì›))
dataList.description: Dutayeon Valley is located north of the Civilian Control Line, requiring advance reservation through the Yanggu-gun Office website as well as filling out admission information at the Dutayeon Gallery before entering the area with a guide. The valley has a waterfall located along Sataecheon Stream where it merges with Suipcheon Stream. The water falls into a plunge pool, which has also carved out a deep cave in the bedrock at the base of the waterfall.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Dutasan National Recreational Forest  (êµ­ë¦½ ë‘íƒ€ì‚°ìì—°íœ´ì–‘ë¦¼)
dataList.description: Dutasan National Recreational Forest is located at the foot of Dutasan Mountain, which rises 1,357 meters above the sea level and straddles the border between Jinbu-myeon of Pyeongchang-gun and Jeongseon-gun. The recreational forest is in the center of many popular attractions, including Odaesan National Park, Woljeongsa Temple, and beautiful valleys. The robust and rich forest is filled with a wide variety of animals such as badgers, raccoons, boars, and hares, as well as abundant medicinal herbs, and trees such as huge birch, nut trees and lime trees.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Dutasan Mountain (ë‘íƒ€ì‚°)
dataList.description: Standing at 1,357 meters above sea level, Dutasan Mountain is surrounded by famous natural landmarks  Mureunggyegok Valley to the north, Gocheongyegok Valley to the east, Taebaeksan Mountain range to the south, and Jungbongsan Mountain to the west. Moreover, situated along the 3.1 kilometer-long valley connecting Dutasan and Samhwasa Temple are such tourist attractions as Dutasanseong Fortress, Geumnamjeong Pavilion, Yongchupokpo Falls, Ssangpokpo Falls, Osipcheon Stream, and Cheoneunsa Temple.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Dutasan Mountain (ë‘íƒ€ì‚°)
dataList.description:
Standing at 1,357 meters above sea level, Dutasan Mountain is a major mountain amid the Taebaeksanmaek Mountain Range. It is especially known for Swinumjeong Pavilion, plunge basin, azalea trees, nut pines, and colorful fall foliage.

Cheoneunsa Temple, where Lee Seung-Hyu resided during his exile, is located in the Samcheok region of the mountain. Lee was the author of Jewang Ungi, a historical poem written in the late Goryeo period. The name â€œDutaâ€ is a Buddhist term that means retiring from the world to go on a Buddhist retreat.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Deungseon Falls (Samaksan Mountain) (ë“±ì„ í­í¬(ì‚¼ì•…ì‚°))
dataList.description: Samaksan Mountain in Chuncheon is known for many waterfalls in different sizes along the gorge, and especially Deungseon Falls is the best known to tourists. By entering the hiking trail of the falls, you will encounter a narrow and deep gorge. Formed through quartzitic jointing, the gorge has a mysterious atmosphere with its strange rocks and bizarre stones, which look sharp and precipitous. As the gorge and falls keep their cool temperature, the area is a popular summer resort. Deungseon Falls is one of the Eight Sights of Deungseon, along with Seunghak Falls, BaengnyeonÂ Falls, and Biryong Falls. The quickest way to get to Deungseon Falls starts from the Deungseon Falls Ticket Booth, which is close to Gangchon.
dataList.author: korea-tour
